model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
the grocery store contacted me to offer me the job I had applied for.
Oh, that's good news; what position did you apply for?
A shift lead position. Not a ton of money, but I love the location of the store and everyone seems really nice. I'm excited! What have you been doing for work?
Well, I'm actually in between jobs right now. I have however been helping my neighbor John with some side projects to make some cash; to be honest, he pays more than if I had an actual job. lol
Yeah, that's not bad. And then it's under the table, so you don't have to pay the taxes on it, so that's a win when you don't have a lot of money coming in. Is there something you'd really like to do career-wise? 
I was thinking maybe something to do with the park system, maybe like a guide or something like that. I'd like that, but realistically, who knows.
That sounds wonderful! You'd get to just be out in nature all day. Sounds like a great job, especially if you're a bit introverted like me. That's why hiking is my favorite -- a good solitary activity. 
Yes, I agree. What kind of hours would this new job have?
It's third shift, which isn't the greatest, but it pays a bit more than the other shifts, and I think I'll like getting off early in the morning. Then I can just go down and get in my hammock and have a nice relaxing moment after work.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Camping and Hiking', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and Speaker B discuss their love for camping and hiking.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: I'm just camping at the moment. Can't wait for the stars tonight. Hello! ### Speaker B: I like to camp! I also go hiking a lot.. ### Speaker A: Nice. I just finished high school. Left my small hamlet behind. Never going back. ### Speaker B: What kind of person are you. I am kind, caring and and hopeful for group equality! ### Speaker A: That's cool. I'm a loner, shy. I'm on a cross country journey. Looking for jobs. ### Speaker B: So, I assume your an adult. Do you vote? I don't! ### Speaker A: No I don't care about voting. I may send my parents a post card. Not sure. ### Speaker B: Would you write one to my neighbor john? I love him! ### Speaker A: Sure what should it say. ### Speaker B: I wish for group equality! ### Speaker A: To your neighbour john? You love him... But it will just say group equality? ### Speaker B: Yes, I also want him to know I do not choose to vote. ### Speaker A: I set up a hammock at my camp site.  ### Speaker B: I love hammocks and have one in my backyard.  The problem is that my dog loves it more than me and I can never get to it before him! ### Speaker A: He's hogging the hamock? Adorable LOL, wish I had a fun pet too ### Speaker B: He hogs everything.  In my house, the pecking order is children, dog, and then me.  I guess that's why I like hiking so much, I don't have to compete with anyone when out on the trail. ### Speaker A: Haha what, aren't you all about equality? It's kind of you to let them ahead lol Where do you hike? ### Speaker B: The Columbia Trail runs fairly close to my home.  I like it there and it is not usually crowded.  Have you ever been there? ### Speaker A: I haven't but it sounds lovely. Maybe I'll see if I can do a camping and hiking trip there sometime.  ### Speaker B: It is really nice.  If you decide to do it, let me know...my favorite part is Ken Lockwood Gorge near High Bridge.  ' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Working at a Grocery Store', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A talks about applying to work at a grocery store near the hiking trail.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker B: Will do, I'll ask him if he knows anyone how is looking to hire also. ### Speaker A: I applied to work at a grocery store.  ### Speaker B: Oh good! Is it the local market or another one? ### Speaker A: It's the one by the hiking trail. Then I could go for hikes after work.  ### Speaker B: That's a great store. I think you'll like working there. My friend worked there for a while and she loved the people. And that's a great trail, too. ' }
```
